title: Religious diversity in Middle East/North Africa in 2010 , by religion
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Muslims and lowest at Religion Unaffiliated.
The lowest value at Religion Unaffiliated is 93.0x times less than the highest value at Muslims.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 5 number of Religions.
The maximum Percentage of population 93.0 is found at Religion Muslims and the minimum is found at Unaffiliated where Religion is 1.0.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Muslims and lowest at Religion Unaffiliated.
The lowest value at Religion Unaffiliated is 93.0x times less than the highest value at Muslims.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 5 number of Religions.
Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population and Unaffiliated has the lowest Percentage of population.
The highest Religion Muslims has 92.0 more Percentage of population than the lowest Religion Unaffiliated.
Percentage of population at Religion Muslims is 93.0 , second place is Christians at 4.0, and thirdly is Jews at 2.0.
Religion Unaffiliated, and Hindus have a similar Percentage of population that is 1.0.
The Religion Unaffiliated has 4.6 times less Percentage of population than average.
